A001.description: Certificate of authenticity fresh 'EMPEROR' table grapes. EC regulation 1832/2002 amending Annex 1 to Council regulation 2658/87 on the tariff and statistical nomenclature and on the Common Customs Tariff.
A001.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the Certificate of authenticity for fresh 'EMPEROR' table grapes.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of certificates covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the certificates concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
A001.guidance_chief: - Use status code <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>.

C001.description: Attestation of equivalence as mentioned in Regulation (EC) No 1295/2008 (OJ L 340) on the importation of Hops from third countries. Products of the hops sector may be imported from third countries only if their quality standards are at least equivalent to those adopted for like products harvested within the Union or made from such products. Products shall be considered to be of the standard referred to in paragraph 1 if they are accompanied by an attestation issued by the authorities of the country of origin and recognised as equivalent to the certificate referred to in Article 77 of Regulation (EU) No. 704/2014.
C001.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by:

- Control - ATT and the reference number of the document.

- Equivalence - ATT and the reference number of the document.

- If using more than one Attestation document, then a separate C001 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each document.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>

C019.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Outward Processing authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an Outward Processing authorisation is held, i.e. OPO 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C019.guidance_chief:
- Reference: OP authorisation reference as defined under Box 44 CUSTOMS SCHEMES.

- Faxed copy not acceptable.

- Note: No status code (as contained in document status codes for harmonised declarations) is required.

- Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>.

C043.description: ICCAT bigeye tuna re-export certificate or IOTC bigeye tuna re-export certificate. COUNCIL REGULATION (EC) No 1984/2003 establishing a system of statistical registration in the Union concerning bluefin tuna and swordfish and bigeye tuna
C043.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the <abbr title='International Commission For The Conservation Of Atlantic Tunas'>ICCAT</abbr> bigeye re-export or <abbr title='Indian Ocean Tuna Commission'>IOTC</abbr> bigeye tuna re-export Certificate.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of certificates covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the certificates concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>

C050.description:
Certificate as mentioned in the Regulation (EU) No. 1308/2013 (OJ L347). Certificate of quality for products of the hops sector, prohibiting the marketing of those products without a certificate as mentioned in Regulation (EU) No. 1308/2013 (OJ L347). Certificates may be issued only for products having the minimum quality characteristics appropriate to a specific stage of marketing. In the case of hop powder, hop powder with higher lupulin content, extract of hops and mixed hop products, the certificate may only be issued if the alpha acid content of these products is not lower than that of the hops from which they have been prepared. 3. The certificates shall at least indicate: (a) the place(s) of production of the hops; (b) the year(s) of harvesting; and (c) the variety or varieties. 4. Products of the hops sector may be marketed or exported only if covered by a certificate issued in accordance with Article 77. Certificate as mentioned in the Regulation (EU) No. 1308/2013 (OJ L347).
Certificate of quality for products of the hops sector, prohibiting the marketing of those products without a certificate as mentioned in Regulation (EU) No. 1308/2013 (OJ L347).
Certificates may be issued only for products having the minimum quality characteristics appropriate to a specific stage of marketing. In the case of hop powder, hop powder with higher lupulin content, extract of hops and mixed hop products, the certificate may only be issued if the alpha acid content of these products is not lower than that of the hops from which they have been prepared.
3. The certificates shall at least indicate: 
(a) the place(s) of production of the hops; 
(b) the year(s) of harvesting; and
(c) the variety or varieties.
4. Products of the hops sector may be marketed or exported only if covered by a certificate issued in accordance with Article 77.
In the case of imported products of the hops sector, the attestation provided for in Article 190(2) shall be deemed to be equivalent to that certificate (see C001).
C050.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the Certificate of quality for products of the hops sector, prohibiting the marketing of those products without a certificate as mentioned in Regulation (EU) No. 1308/2013 (OJ L347).

- Where a sequentially numbered range of certificates covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the certificates concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

C073.description:
REACH Authorisation, according to Title VII of Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006

C073.guidance_cds:
- Provide the <abbr title='Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals'>REACH</abbr> authorisation decision number

- No document status code is required.

C074.description:
Zootechnical certificate (Regulation (EU) 2016/1012, Article 37) Purebred animals imported for breeding prposes shall be accompanied by: 

- the zootechnical certificate referred to in Article 30 (5) or Article 32 of Regulation (EU) 2016/1012; 

- a document indicating that they are to be entered in a breeding book maintained by a breed society or registered in a breeding register maintained by a breeding operation. 
When declaring document code C074, document code C075 must also be declared
C074.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the Certificate.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of certificates covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the certificates concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>IE</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - surrendered'>IS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr>

C075.description:
Document indicating that purebred breeding animals are to be entered in a breeding book maintained by a breed society or registered in a breeding register maintained by a breeding operation (Regulation (EU) 2016/1012, Article 37) 
Purebred animals imported for breeding prposes shall be accompanied by: 

- the zootechnical certificate referred to in Article 30(5) or Article 32 of Regulation (EU) 2016/1012; 

- a document indicating that they are to be entered in a breeding book maintained by a breed society or registered in a breeding register maintained by a breeding operation
When declaring document code C074, document code C075 must also be declared
C075.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of breeding document which relates to the certificated declared under document code C074.

- There must be a full audit trail between the breeding document and the zootechnical certificate.

C081.description: Self-certification Simplified V I 1 document. EC REG 555/2008 laying down detailed rules for the application of Regulation (EC) 479/2008 of the relative Council, to the common organization of the wine market, with regard to support programs to trade with third countries production potential and controls in the wine sector.
C081.guidance_cds:

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - C082.description: Copy of the declaration of conformity - Option C, as referred to in Article 1.2 and in the Annex of Regulation (EU) 2016/879 Manufacture and importation of refrigeration, air conditioning and heat pump equipment containing hydrofluorocarbons. C084.description: Exemption by virtue of Articles 3 and 4 of Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2019/2122 (Animals intended for scientific purposes, research and diagnostic samples). Certain categories of animals and goods that are exempted from official controls at border control posts as defined in Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2019/2122
C084.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'regulation 2019/2122 exempt'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are not concerned by Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2019/2122 adopting a list of animals and goods exempt from official controls at border control posts.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this waiver which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.

C085.guidance_cds:
- Enter GBCHD followed by the reference number of the CHED-PP.

- A separate C085 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each individual CHED-PP.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>

C089.description: Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2021/442 of 11 March 2021 making the exportation of certain products subject to the production of an export authorisation. Vaccines against SARS-related coronaviruses (SARS-CoV species) and active substances, including master and working cell banks used for the manufacture of such vaccines See also document code Y981
C089.guidance_cds:
- Enter the export authorisation reference number.

- If more than one export authorisation covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - already attributed on simplified declaration'>UA</abbr>

C100.description: Registered Exporter Number (REX). EC regulation 2447/2015 of the UCC IA for 'Implementing Act'. This document code must be declared whenever a preference document code requiring a REX authorisation is declared
C100.guidance_cds:
- Enter the Registered Exporter Number.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='To be used when declaration of a REX number is required'>RE</abbr>
C100.guidance_chief: - Document status code will be <abbr title='To be used when declaration of a REX number is required'>RE</abbr>.

C119.description: Authorised Release Certificate - EASA Form 1 (Appendix I to Annex I to Regulation (EU) No 748/2012), or equivalent certificate Formerly referred to as: Airworthiness certificate
C119.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the Authorised Release Certificate, formerly referred to as Certificate of airworthiness or equivalent certificate.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of certificates covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the certificates concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Faxed copy not acceptable

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>

C400.description: Presentation of the required 'CITES' certificate. Commission regulation 160/2017 amending Council regulation (EC) No 338/97 on the protection of species of wild fauna and flora by regulating trade therein. See also Document Codes, C635, C638 and Y900
C400.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by: 

- For imports: ICP and the certificate number.

- For exports: ECP and the certificate number.

- If using more than one certificate, then a separate C400 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each certificate.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>

C401.description: CITES Export permit or Re-export certificate issued by an EU-country. Commission regulation 2017/160 amending Council regulation (EC) No 338/97 on the protection of species of wild fauna and flora by regulating trade therein.
C401.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES export permit or re-export certificate issued by an EU-country.

- If using more than one permit, then a separate C401 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each permit.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>

C402.description: CITES Export permit or Re-export certificate issued by a third country. Commission regulation 2017/160 amending Council regulation (EC) No 338/97 on the protection of species of wild fauna and flora by regulating trade therein.
C402.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES export permit or re-export certificate issued by a third country.

- If using more than one permit, then a separate C402 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each permit.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>

C403.description: CITES Travelling exhibition certificate. Commission regulation 2017/160 amending Council regulation (EC) No 338/97 on the protection of species of wild fauna and flora by regulating trade therein.
C403.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES travelling exhibition certificate.

- If using more than one certificate, then a separate C403 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each certificate.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>

C404.description: CITES Personal ownership certificate. Commission regulation 2017/160 amending Council regulation (EC) No 338/97 on the protection of species of wild fauna and flora by regulating trade therein.
C404.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES personal ownership certificate.

- If using more than one certificate, then a separate C404 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each certificate.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>

C405.description: CITES Sample collection certificate. Commission regulation 2017/160 amending Council regulation (EC) No 338/97 on the protection of species of wild fauna and flora by regulating trade therein.
C405.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES sample collection certificate.

- If using more than one certificate, then a separate C405 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each certificate.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>

C406.description: CITES Musical instrument certificate. Commission regulation 2017/160 amending Council regulation (EC) No 338/97 on the protection of species of wild fauna and flora by regulating trade therein.
C406.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES musical instrument Certificate.

- If using more than one certificate, then a separate C406 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each certificate.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>

C501.description: AEOC - Authorisation for the status of Authorised Economic Operator - Customs Simplifications (Column 2, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C501.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Authorised Economic Operator - Customs Simplifications - authorisation in the format:

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 4 digit code indicating that an Authorised Economic Operator - Customs Simplification - authorisation is held, i.e. AEOC 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C502.description: AEOS - Authorisation for the status of Authorised Economic Operator - Security and safety (Column 2, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C502.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Authorised Economic Operator - Security and Safety - authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 4 digit code indicating that an Authorised Economic Operator - Security and Safety - is held, i.e. AEOS 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C503.description: AEOF - Authorisation for the status of Authorised Economic Operator - Customs simplifications/Security and safety (Column 2, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C503.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Authorised Economic Operator - Customs Simplification/Security and Safety - authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 4 digit code indicating that an Authorised Economic Operator - Customs Simplification/Security and Safety - is held, i.e. AEOF 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C504.description: CVA - Authorisation for the simplification of the determination of amounts being part of the customs value of goods (Column 3, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C504.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the authorisation for the simplification of the determination of amounts being part of the customs value of goods in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorisation for the simplification of the determination of amounts being part of the customs value of goods is held, i.e. CVA 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C505.description: For cases where a comprehensive guarantee is not required (including deferment accounts, OGDs, Public Bodies, fixed energy installations and goods below the statistical threshold): CGU - Authorisation for the provision of a comprehensive guarantee, including possible reduction or waiver (Column 4a, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446). (see previous code for when a guarantee is required)
C505.guidance_cds:
Enter: 


GBCGUguaranteenotrequired 

For deferment accounts: 


Enter status code CC 

For OGDs and Public Bodies: 


Enter status code <abbr title='Waiver claimed'>XW</abbr>

For fixed energy installations: 


Enter status code <abbr title='Waiver claimed'>XW</abbr> 

For goods exempted under TA (article 81, regulation No. (EU) 2015/2446: 


Enter status code <abbr title='Waiver claimed'>XW</abbr> 

For goods below the statistical threshold: 


Enter status code <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below 'de minimus''>XB</abbr>

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): CC, <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below 'de minimus''>XB</abbr>, <abbr title='Waiver claimed'>XW</abbr>

C506.description: DPO - Authorisation for the deferment of payment (Column 4b, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446)).
C506.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the deferment of payment authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a deferment of payment authorisation is held, i.e. DPO 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C507.description: REP - Decision for the repayment of the amounts of import or export duty, including C&E 1179 claims (Column 4c, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C507.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the repayment decision.

- Or Enter the reference number assigned by the exporter to the application for the rejected import claim.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - already attributed on simplified declaration'>UA</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is unavailable - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>UP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - surrendered'>US</abbr>, <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below 'de minimus''>XB</abbr>

C508.description: REM - Decision for the remission of the amounts of import or export duty (Column 4c, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C508.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the remission decision.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - already attributed on simplified declaration'>UA</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is unavailable - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>UP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - surrendered'>US</abbr>, <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below 'de minimus''>XB</abbr>

C509.description: TST - Authorisation for the operation of storage facilities for the temporary storage of goods (Column 5, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C509.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the operation of temporary storage facilities authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an operation of temporary storage facilities authorisation is held, i.e. TST 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C510.description: RSS - Authorisation to establish regular shipping services (Column 6a, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C510.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the regular shipping services authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a regular shipping services authorisation is held, i.e. RSS 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C511.description: ACP - Authorisation for the status of authorised issuer to establish the proof of the customs status of Union goods (Column 6b, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C511.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the status of authorised issuer authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C512.description: SDE - Authorisation to use simplified declaration (Column 7a, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C512.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the simplified declaration authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a simplified declaration authorisation is held, i.e. SDE 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C513.description: CCL - Authorisation for centralised clearance (Column 7b, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446) including SASP.
C513.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the centralised clearance in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a centralised clearance authorisation is held, i.e. CCL 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C514.description: EIR - Authorisation for making a customs declaration through an entry in the declarant's records, including for the export procedure (Column 7c, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C514.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for EIDR in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an EIDR authorisation is held, i.e. EIR 

- Followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C515.description: SAS - Authorisation for self-assessment (Column 7d, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C515.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation number for self-assessment in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a self-assessment authorisation is held, i.e. SAS 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C516.description: TEA/ TEAH - Authorisation for the use of temporary admission (Column 8d, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C516.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation number for temporary admission in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3/4 digit code indicating that a temporary admission authorisation) is held, i.e. TEA/TEAH 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C517.description: CWP - Authorisation for the operation of storage facilities for the customs warehousing of goods in a private customs warehouse (Column 8e, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C517.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the private customs warehouse in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating the type of warehouse, i.e. CWP

- alpha numeric code issued by the authorising member state for the warehouse.

- In the UK this will be the warehouse ID No. as declared in DE 2/7 (ex-box 49 on a SAD/ C88) 

- Note: if goods are being transferred from one private customs warehouse to another private customs warehouse, enter the code for the receiving warehouse.

- The dispatching warehouse is entered as a PREMS statement in DE 2/2 - Please see the Procedure Code notes and Appendix 4 for further details.

- No document status code is required.

C518.description: CW1 - Authorisation for the operation of storage facilities for the customs warehousing of goods in a public customs warehouse type I (Column 8e, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C518.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the customs warehouse in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating the type of warehouse, i.e. CW1

- alpha numeric code issued by the authorising member state for the warehouse.

- In the UK this will be the warehouse ID No. as declared in DE 2/7 (ex-box 49 on a SAD/ C88).

- No document status code is required.

C519.description: CW2 - Authorisation for the operation of storage facilities for the customs warehousing of goods in a public customs warehouse type II (Column 8e, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C519.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the customs warehouse in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB

- 3-digit code indicating the type of warehouse, i.e. CW2

- alpha numeric code issued by the authorising member state for the warehouse.

- In the UK this will be the warehouse ID No. as declared in DE 2/7 (ex-box 49 on a SAD/ C88)

- No document status code is required.

C520.description: ACT - Authorisation for the status of authorised consignee for TIR procedure (Column 9a, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C520.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation number for the ACT status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorised consignee for TIR procedure authorisation is held, i.e. ACT

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C521.description: ACR - Authorisation for the status of authorised consignor for Union transit (Column 9b, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C521.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the ACR status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorised consignor for Union transit authorisation is held, i.e. ACR

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C522.description: ACE - Authorisation for the status of authorised consignee for Union transit (Column 9c, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C522.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the ACE status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorised consignee for Union transit authorisation is held, i.e. ACE

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.

C523.description: SSE - Authorisation for the use of seals of a special type (Column 9d, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C523.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the SSE status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorisation for the use of seals of a special type is held, i.e. SSE

C524.description: TRD - Authorisation to use transit declaration with a reduced dataset (Column 9e, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C524.guidance_cds:

C525.guidance_cds:

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB

C526.description: AWB - Authorisation for the status of authorised weigher of bananas (Column 7e, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C526.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the AWB status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a weigher of bananas authorisation is held, i.e. AWB

- No document status code is required.

C600.description: Authorisation to operate a Free Zone
C600.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Free Zone in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 2 digit code indicating that a Free Zone authorisation is held, i.e. FZ 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C600.guidance_chief:
- Reference: Enter either :

- details of guarantee (if applicable); or

- if goods are being transferred from one warehouse/free zone to another, enter the code for the dispatching warehouse/free zone.

- Note: No status code (as contained in document status codes for harmonised declarations) is required.

C601.description: IPO - Authorisation for the use of inward processing procedure (Column 8a, Annex A of Delegated regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C601.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Inward processing authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an inward processing authorisation is held, i.e. IPO 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C601.guidance_chief:
- Reference: <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>IP</abbr> authorisation reference as defined under Box 44 CUSTOMS SCHEMES.

- Faxed copy not acceptable.

- Note: No status code (as contained in document status codes for harmonised declarations) is required.

C602.description: Declaration of particulars relating to customs value (continuation sheet D.V.1BIS).
C602.guidance_cds:
- Enter 'DV1 cont.

- sheet completed'

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>
C602.guidance_chief:
- There is no formal reference for a C105A.

- Declarant has the option to enter a reference.

C603.description: Information sheet INF1 for inward processing (C&E1143).
C603.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the INF1.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of INF1 cover the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the INF1 concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where INF1 are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each INF1 concerned.

- Faxed copy not acceptable.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>
C603.guidance_chief:
- Use status code <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr> if certification is required otherwise use status code <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>.

- Faxed copy not acceptable.

- Enter the reference number of the INF2.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of INF2s cover the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the INF2s concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where INF2s are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each INF2 concerned.

- Faxed copy not acceptable

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>
C604.guidance_chief:
- Use status code <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr> if certification is required otherwise use status code <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>.

C605.guidance_chief:
- Use status code <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr> if certification is required otherwise use status code <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>.

C606.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the INF5.

C606.guidance_chief:

C610.guidance_chief:

C612.guidance_cds:
- The Movement Reference Number (<abbr title='Movement Reference Number'>MRN</abbr>) for the Union transit movement.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr>
C612.guidance_chief:
- The Movement Reference Number (<abbr title='Movement Reference Number'>MRN</abbr>) for the Common/Community transit movement.

- Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr>.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of Consignment notes cover the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the Consignment notes concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where Consignment notes are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr>
C613.guidance_chief: - Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr>.

C614.guidance_chief: - Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr>.

C624.guidance_chief: - With the exception of <abbr title='Facsimile attached - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>FP</abbr>, <abbr title='Facsimile with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>HP</abbr>, the U series and <abbr title='Electronic or paper document to be advised'>XA</abbr>, enter appropriate status code listed in document status codes for harmonised declarations.

C625.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the Manifest.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of Manifests cover the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the Manifests concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where Manifests are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each Manifest concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr>
C625.guidance_chief: - Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr>.

C626.description: BTI - Decision relating to Binding Tariff Information (Column 1a, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C626.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Binding Tariff Information in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a Binding Tariff Information 

- decision is held, i.e. BTI (see note below) 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C626.guidance_chief:
- Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>.

- Enter the BTI reference(s) held for the goods described in Box 31 e.g. 'BTIUK54321'.

C627.description: BOI - Decision relating to Binding Origin Information (Column 1b, Annex A of Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/2446).
C627.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Binding Origin Information in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a Binding Origin Information is held, i.e. BOI

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C627.guidance_chief:
- Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - already attributed on simplified declaration'>UA</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is unavailable - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>UP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - surrendered'>US</abbr>, <abbr title='Electronic or paper document to be advised'>XA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below 'de minimus''>XB</abbr>.

- Also insert the Binding Origin Information (BOI) number -, e.g. UK

- 2007/xxx

C631.description: Formal letter validating the use of non-wooden or recycled materials for paper products, issued by the Ministry of Industry of the FLEGT VPA partner country from which the paper products are originating.
C631.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the letter.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of letters cover the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the letters concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where letters are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each letter concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - already attributed on simplified declaration'>UA</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is unavailable - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>UP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - surrendered'>US</abbr>, <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below 'de minimus''>XB</abbr>

C635.description: CITES Label for Scientific Material. Commission regulation 160/2017 on the protection of species of wild fauna and flora by regulating trade therein. Please note that this code is not currently mandated for CITES measures. See documents codes C400 and Y900.
C635.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by: 

- For imports: ICP and the label number.

- For exports: ECP and the label number.

- If using more than one label, then a separate C635 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each label.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
C635.guidance_chief: - Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr> or <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>.

C638.description: CITES Import or Export permit. Commission regulation 160/2017 on the protection of species of wild fauna and flora by regulating trade therein. Please note that this code is not currently mandated for CITES measures. See documents codes C400 and Y900.
C638.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by: 

- For imports: ICP and the permit number.

- For exports: ECP and the permit number.

- If using more than one permit, then a separate C638 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each licence.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>
C638.guidance_chief: - Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr> or <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>.

C639.description: CITES Import or export notification. Commission regulation 160/2017 on the protection of species of wild fauna and flora by regulating trade therein.
C639.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by: 

- For imports: ICP and the notification number.

- For exports: ECP and the notification number.

- If using more than one notification, then a separate C639 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each notification.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>
C639.guidance_chief: - Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr> or <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>.

C640.description: Common Health Entry Document for Animals (CHED-A) (as set out in Part 2, Section A of Annex II to Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2019/1715 (OJ L 261)), used for animals referred to in point (a) of Article 47(1) of Regulation (EU) 2017/625)
C640.guidance_cds:
- Enter GBCHDyyyy. followed by the reference number of the CHED-A.

- A separate C640 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each individual CHED-A.

- Note yyyy. represents the year in which the licence was issued, for example GBCHD2021.

- The '.' after the year is part of the licence completion requirements

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>
C640.guidance_chief: - <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr> or <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document doesn't apply'>XX</abbr>

C641.description: Dissostichus - catch document import. COUNCIL REGULATION (EC) No 1368/2006 establishing a catch documentation scheme for Dissostichus spp.
C641.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by TFC and the catch document number.

- If using more than one catch document, then a separate C641 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each catch document.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>IE</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>IP</abbr>
C641.guidance_chief:
- Enter the unique document number.

- Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>IE</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>IP</abbr>.

C644.description: Certificate of inspection for organic products. Council Regulation (EC) No 834/2007 on organic production and labelling of organic products and repealing Regulation (EEC) No 2092/91. See also document code Y929
C644.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the Certificate.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of certificates covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the certificates concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>
C644.guidance_chief: - Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>.

C645.guidance_cds:
- Enter MoD certificate reference number - in the format 'UK/.....' entering the relevant certificate number after 'UK/' Faxed copy not acceptable.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is unavailable - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>UP</abbr>
C645.guidance_chief:
- Enter MoD certificate reference number

- in the format 'UK/.....', inserting the relevant certificate number after 'UK/'

- Faxed copy not acceptable.

- Use [status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr> or <abbr title='Evidence required is unavailable - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>UP</abbr> as appropriate.

C647.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the Document.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of Documents cover the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the Documents concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where Documents are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each Document concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>
C647.guidance_chief: - Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>.

C651.description: Electronic administrative document (e-AD), as referred to in Article 3(1) of Reg. (EC) No 684/2009.
C651.guidance_cds:
- Enter the ARC number of the e-AD.

- A separate C651 entry in DE2/3 is required for each individual e-AD

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>

C652.description: Accompanying documents for the carriage of wine products. COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 394/2005, amending Regulation (EC) No 795/2004, laying down detailed rules for the implementation of the single payment scheme provided for in Council Regulation (EC) No 1782/2003. Establishing common rules for direct support schemes under the common agricultural policy and establishing certain support schemes for farmers, and derogating from Regulation (EC) No 1782/2003.
